meanings.sent1: She nearly caught the ball before it fell.
meanings.sent2: I nearly missed the bus this morning.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel nearly made it across the road before stopping to check for acorns.
meanings.sent4: His answer was nearly as clear as mud.
meanings.sent5: The cake was nearly perfect, but it needed a bit more sugar.

meanings.sent1: The nearly finished puzzle only had a few pieces left.
meanings.sent2: We were nearly late for the movie because of traffic.
meanings.sent3: The nearly ripe banana was still a bit green at the top.
meanings.sent4: Her nearly silent footsteps startled me in the quiet hallway.
meanings.sent5: The nearly empty glass teetered on the edge of the table.

meanings.sent1: She ate nearly all the cookies in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: I've read nearly all the books in this library.
meanings.sent3: The students were nearly all asleep during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden were nearly all in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: He had nearly all the ingredients for the recipe except for the salt.

meanings.definition: Almost, but not completely or entirely
meanings.sent1: The cat nearly caught the mouse before it escaped.
meanings.sent2: I nearly forgot to turn off the lights before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The cake was nearly finished baking when the power went out.
meanings.sent4: She nearly missed the train by a few seconds.
meanings.sent5: The tree nearly blocked the entire view from the window.
